page.title: 07The Corn Drier.
page.content: Mr. Laming took us to see the corn drier on his farm. It is a big building made from asbestos with large sliding doors at the front. Inside it is divided into two halves with a tunnel between. In one half there was barley and the other wheat. When the crop has been collected from the fields it is taken into the corn drier. Before it is put on the floor some metal boxes with holes in them are connected to the tunnel. These are layed across the floor and the seed is put on top. Then air is blown through to dry the crop. When the crop is sold Mr. Laming uses a tractor to load the seed onto lorries but he has to be careful not to pick up the metal boxes too. He told us that newer corn driers have boxes that fit in channels in the floor. Mr. Laming sells most of his crops to Spillers in Gainsborough.
